disclaimerData.disclaimer:
PATIENT AGREEMENT: This form provides information about the advantages and risks of laser wart removal. Read thoroughly and discuss with your skincare professional before proceeding.

Take time to consider all options, seek second opinions, and ask questions. Laser wart removal (CO2, pulsed dye, or Nd:YAG lasers) targets HPV-infected tissue, coagulating blood vessels and vaporizing wart cells precisely without damaging surrounding skin. Numbing cream applied first; sessions last 5-15 minutes. Most warts require 1-3 treatments spaced 3-4 weeks apart; recurrence possible if virus persists.

Improvements visible within 1-2 weeks as crust falls off; protect area from sun (SPF 50+) 2 weeks pre/post, keep moisturized, no picking scabs. Multiple sessions may be needed; informed of practitioner/location each time, withdraw consent anytime.

RISKS AND POSSIBLE REACTIONS: Common: pain (rubber band snap), redness, swelling, blistering, crusting resolving in 7-14 days. Less common: infection (poor aftercare), hyperpigmentation/hypopigmentation (higher darker skin tones), temporary textural changes.

Rare: scarring (if improper settings), burns, bleeding, wart recurrence. Contraindications: active infections, photosensitive medications, recent isotretinoin (6 months), genital warts (specialized care), pregnancy.

I confirm understanding of procedure reasons, risks (including not treating), personal health risks, benefits, alternatives (cryotherapy, salicylic acid, surgery), uncertainties, follow-up care.

MEDICAL IMAGERY: I authorize clinical photos/videos for confidential records.

I certify reading/understanding this form, questions answered satisfactorily, and consent to procedure.

questions.content: Do you comprehend the details that have been given to you?
Do you believe enough information has been shared to allow you to give informed consent?
Have you given your consent voluntarily?
Are there any health issues you currently have?
Are you currently pregnant or nursing a child?
Do you suffer from a neuromuscular disorder (such as Multiple Sclerosis, ALS, motor neuropathy, myasthenia gravis, or Lambert-Eaton syndrome)?
Do you have an autoimmune condition?
Do you experience any skin problems?
Do you have any known allergies or a history of severe allergic reactions (anaphylaxis)?
Is there an active infection at the area where the procedure is planned?
Are you currently on any antibiotics or other prescribed medications?
Is there any other Medical or Social History we should be aware of? If yes, please explain in detail.
What are your goals and desired results for undergoing this procedure? Please elaborate.
Have you undergone this or a comparable treatment previously? If so, were there any issues? Please provide details.
Do you have any concerns? If so, please describe them.
Is there anything else we need to know? Please provide full information.
I will keep this information for the duration of my treatment and consult it as needed.
